intro: Glossocalyx, commonly known as the glossy calyx plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, glossy, and often colorful calyx that remains prominent even after the flower has faded. The plant typically features small, white or yellowish flowers that are surrounded by a showy, persistent calyx. Glossocalyx is native to tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Africa and parts of Asia. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique and attractive foliage.
